itemDescription: A soft and durable felt hat fashioned to stylize, not necessarily protect, the most important part of your body.
itemLore: Just because those bookish types are smart doesn't mean they know nothin'. Some of the best thinking comes from the commonfolk, but because they can't spell or count right, nobody cares to listen.

itemDescription: The visibility in this helmet leaves much to be desired, but that's not really the point. It goes a long way in keeping your head on your shoulders.
itemLore: Believe it or not, I've met certain folks who have risen above reliance on the five senses. In place of sight and sound, they rely on foresight and instinct.

itemDescription: For some reason, your head feels naked without this simple baseball cap with a fox logo. That aside, it keeps the sun out of your eyes, and that's all you ask of it.
itemLore: It's funny how something as trivial as a cloth cap can call to mind more innocent times. In these dark days, that's arguable more vital than a solid defense.

itemDescription: It's like putting your head inside the monsters you've been killing all this time. It's comfortable enough though, so long as you don't think about where it's been.
itemLore: The corruption began as an idea, a seed released by witnessing the truth of all things. Like all ideas, the seed took root. It bloomed, and the ide took form, growing of its own accord, until it could no longer be quelled even by those who created it.

itemDescription: This headpiece hails from the wild and mysterious world of Yaesha. Its smooth,featureless. design is both eerie and elegant, painted a stark white and adornedwith luxuriant fur and imposing horns.
itemLore: The mask, crafted by the Red Widows of Yaesha, serves as a haunting reminderthat power can shift in an instant, depending on the tools at hand. It's a testamentto the fact that those who were once healers and medicine women can becomequeens, elders, and even gods with the right resources.

itemDescription: It feels like you're not wearing any helmet at all - you'd swear you could even feel the wind in your hair. Yet it turns an arrow as effectively as any steel.
itemLore: Who watches the king's men? They themselves do. There is no trust among the royal guard except in battle. Each watches the other, seeking any opportunity to betray one another, thus gaining accolades for themselves.

itemDescription: While it may shield your eyes from the sun, it's not particularly protective against the dangers of the Root.
itemLore: I sed to wear a field cap and sunglasses combo like this during field operations. It's a practical and comfortable headwear that helps reduce glare and keeps the sun out of your eyes.

itemDescription: This face covering protects you from contagions without obstructing your sight. You feel like a creature from another world in this thing. Perhaps that's fitting.
itemLore: In a world of living nightmares, you think of a hero as the person with the shiny blade spilling blood and slicing up monsters. Don't ever forget that it takes a certain brand of bravery to go back for the wounded and challenge death itself.

itemDescription: Something about this hat just feels right. Paired with a bandana, it keeps the sun and elements from hindering your all-important aim.
itemLore: If you ever catch sight of cold steel and a colder gaze aimed at you from beneath a wide-brim hat, it's time to make your peace.

itemDescription: A hauntingly familiar visage, convincing enough to still be alive. To truly know your enemy, you must get inside its head. Literally.
itemLore: To hunt is to know its prey. To see what they see. Hear what they hear. But know them too well, and it may become prey itself

itemDescription: The skull-like helm hails from the inhospitable world of Rhom, where survival demands more than just strength and cunning. Fashioned from a mysterious material, its surface glimmers with an otherworldly sheen that seems to shift and change with the light. Its sleek and angular lines, reminiscent of some alien technology, evoke a sense of unease in those who gaze upon it.
itemLore: I dont ever want to go back to that hellhole, just looking this helm reminds me of the horrors I faced on Rhom. I may have left that world behind, but it will always be a part of me.

itemDescription: While this ironclad helmet is somewhat difficult to breathe in, you feel secure knowing even the heaviest weapon would have little chance of cracking into your skull.
itemLore: When the whole world could disappear in the blink of an eye and most folks are getting their affairs in order or trying to find a glimmer of joy in the chaos, leave it to a tried-and-true scientist to focus on protecting their gray matter from the faintest threat of potential damage.

itemDescription: This crown was worn by King Kolket himself. It could be heresy for a paxultek to wear such an artifact, but there are few left among the Pan who would even recognize it as their own.
itemLore: Although much of the knowledge of the ancient Pan has been lost to time, it is known they had their own form of magic. The lodestones are thought to be part of this, allowing them to create artifacts that reacted to each other's presence in unique and sometimes powerful ways.

itemDescription: It's hard to imagine someone piloting an entire world, but that's who this helm was for. The sockets allowed them to speak with N'Erud directly. N'Erud had dozens of pilots, all working in concert-both with each other and with the world itself.
itemLore: Those we dubbed "pilots" were little more than tools--minds serving as interfaces. The Astropaths determined N'Erud's course, and the Custodian ensured the ship arrived safely. Pilots were merely delegates for our collective will.

itemDescription: A hunting mask with advanced respirator capabilities. It purifies yet does nothing to mask the stench of death that permeates the air.
itemLore: When you find yourself staring down a situation where even the air promises destruction, sometimes all that keeps you moving one foot in front of the other is the hunt.

itemDescription: The cowl is a striking blue, which contrasts with the large, featureless golden mask that covers the face of the wearer. This armor was highly coveted and only granted to those few who were recognized as the "Radiant Ones."
itemLore: Despite spending many years on Yaesha, the intricacies of Pan society still elude me, but what I do know for certain is that the Ahanae possessed a mastery over crystal manipulation that defies comprehension.

itemDescription: This hat once belonged to Founder Ford. He was only a captain then-a much younger Ford, from a long time and many lives ago.
itemLore: The Dreamer Program was Harsgaard's brain child. He wasn't the one who discovered the runes or the World Stone, but he figured out what they meant-what they could show us. I I wish to God he hadn't.

itemDescription: The horns of this helmet are ornamental, designed to be displayed in addition to the Pan wearer's own horns-which themselves protrude from additional openings in the armor-to create a truly frightening visage.
itemLore: They say King Kolket was tall-taller than any Pan. He spent most days on the, prow of his vessel so that he could be clearly seen by his people on any other ship as a symbol of hope and defiance against the black waters.

itemDescription: People (Mudtooth mostly) tell stories of how, before the Root, humans could fly into space. It's probably not true, but if it were, they'd need something like this to keep them alive out there.
itemLore: As an Astropath, I have never been outside N'Erud's shell myself. That was the domain of Xul and Ofildi. That is not to say | have not seen the void. I see everything, but what others call void is, to me, an infinite dance of force and light.

itemDescription: An overwhelming amount of information shines within the helmet's display, the vast majority of it incomprehensible. Whether that's because it's a foreign language or the helmet has been damaged by whatever destroyed this place is anybody's guess.
itemLore: House Lythla acquired knowledge beyond anything the other houses could imagine. While the rest of us spent ageless eons searching for signs of life that didn't exist, the Xul's field of study was right in front of them at all times.

itemDescription: This helmet is reminiscent of a statue from a time long, long before.
itemLore: Since the beginning, I have been known only as the Keeper. The entities' use of names and epithets is... inefficient. And strange.

itemDescription: A flashy, flame-hot diadem that demands respect and attention in equal measure...were there any subjects left to offer such sentiments.
itemLore: That the One True King suffered the young prince to live despite his attempted coup is a curious thing. Either the king thought exile a punishment graver than death...or his mercy bespoke that which he dared not otherwise admit.
